title: (x) Theatre Logo Font / 'Landor' - Eden Mills {Jim}
content:
Any help much appreciated.

Just the name of the theatre not the address line.

Cheers  
Rob

| --- | --- |
| [logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20100212133154/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_62.gif) | 6.25 KB |
author: Rob Sutton

comments.content:
Similar to this...but not quite...still looking:

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/van-wyck/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100212133154/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/van-wyck/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/van-wyck/")  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atcapone-light/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100212133154/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atcapone-light/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atcapone-light/")

Might get close by tweaking Operator Nine or Huxley by substituting in the gothic "O"

Yeah, Capone was where I first started looking but it's quite subtle really. Thanks for looking.

Rob
